project

Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • project.Inventory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    this is a inventory class that serves as a controller it stores a list of items and provides functions to modify the inventory
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • inventory

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Item> inventory

    • Constructor Detail

      • Inventory

        public Inventory()

    • Method Detail

      • setInvetoryItem

        public static void setInvetoryItem(double inv,
                   double s,
                   int q,
                   java.lang.String name)
        mutator, sets the invoice price, selling price and quantity for an item in inventory
        Parameters:
        inv - represents the new inventory price that is being passed
        s - represents the new selling price that is being passed
        q - represents the new quantity that is being passed
        name - the name of the item preconditions: the item with this name exist in inventory postconditions: the item was updated with a new selling price, invoice price and quantity and inventory is saved

      • setInvetoryItemQuantity

        public static void setInvetoryItemQuantity()
        mutator, sets the quantity of an item in inventory It takes no parameters, it is called when a customer makes a purchase. It takes the number of items purchased from the shopping cart and subtracts it from the inventory, thus updating and saving the inventory every time a customer makes a purchase. preconditions: the item exist in inventory and shopping cart postconditions: the quantity of all items from the shopping cart was subtracted from inventory

      • removeInvetoryItem

        public static void removeInvetoryItem(java.lang.String name)
        mutator, it removes an item from the inventory completely
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the item that is being removed preconditions: the item exists in inventory postconditions: the item was deleted from inventory

      • createItem

        public static void createItem(Item i)
        mutator, it adds a new item to the inventory
        Parameters:
        i - is the item that is being added preconditions: user has logged in owner mode and clicked on the create item button postconditions: item was added to the inventory

      • createTestItemz

        public static void createTestItemz()
                            throws java.io.IOException
        mutator, this function is for testing purposes It invokes different constructors of item and initializes an inventory if the application is to be run for a first time
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • save

        public static void save()
        mutator, it saves any changes of the items in inventory to a file using serialization It takes no parameters. Needs to be called every time when a change is made.

      • load

        public static void load()
        accessor, it reads all items from a file and adds them in to a array list It needs to be called every time when a view is called

      • displayProfits

        public static void displayProfits()
        accessor, it displays the sales profits up to this point in a JFrame It reads a file that contains the revenue and costs up to this point and calculates profit.

      • addtoProfits

        public static void addtoProfits(double inv,
                double sel,
                int quant)
        mutator, it ads to profits every time a sale was made.
        Parameters:
        inv - is the invoice price of the item that was sold
        sel - is the selling price of the item that was sold
        quant - is the number of items that were sold preconditions: none postconditions: the values of revenue and costs were written to a file

      • findQuantity

        public static int findQuantity(java.lang.String name,
               java.util.ArrayList<Item> list)
        accessor, it returns the quantity of an item from a list of items
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the item that is being inquired
        list - is a list of items to be searched
        Returns:
        the quantity of an item

      • clearProfit

        public static void clearProfit()
        mutator, resets the profits to 0
